poem1.title: The bottom of my shoes "
poem1.content: The bottoms of my shoesare clean. From walking in the rain.
poem1.author: Jack Kerouac

poem2.title: Mosquito at my ear
poem2.content: Mosquito at my ear— does he think I’m deaf?
poem2.author: Kobayashi Issa

poem3.title: [Even with insects]
poem3.content: Even with insects— some can sing,some can’t.
poem3.author: Kobayashi Issa

poem4.title: A Dent in a Bucket
poem4.content: Hammering a dent out of a bucket  a woodpecker  answers from the woods
poem4.author: Kobayashi Issa

poem1.title: [goes out comes back]
poem1.content: Goes out,comes back— the love life of a cat.
poem1.author: Kobayashi Issa

poem2.title: [Under the evening moon]
poem2.content: Under the evening moonthe snail  is stripped to the waist.
poem2.author: Kobayashi Issa

poem3.title: In Kyoto...
poem3.content: In Kyoto,hearing the cuckoo,I long for Kyoto.
poem3.author: Basho

poem4.title: If Not for the Cat
poem4.content: If not for the cat,And the scarcity of cheese,I could be content.
poem4.author: Jack Prelutsky

poem1.title: In my medicine cabinet
poem1.content: In my medicine cabinet the winter fly Has died of old age
poem1.author: Jack Kerouac

poem2.title: Useless! Useless!
poem2.content: Useless! Useless! —heavy rain driving into the sea
poem2.author: Jack Kerouac

poem3.title: [the snow is melting]
poem3.content: The snow is melting  and the village is flooded with children.
poem3.author: Kobayashi Issa

poem4.title: New Year’s morning
poem4.content: New Year's morning:the ducks on the pondquack and quack.
poem4.author: Kobayashi Issa
